instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936-B ram slots not working
threads.message:
Hi, got an 820-2936-B with both ram slots not working

Ive tried several ram sticks with different frecuencies and the mac crashes in boot and sometimes loading macos. Sometimes it gives the artifacts on screen and sometimes the 3 beeps. It also crashes with linux. 

The slots itselves seem in very good condition.

threads.title: 820-2936-B ram slots not working
threads.message:
Do you have DDR3 test card?
Usually broken solders near the edges of the slots.

threads.title: 820-2936-B ram slots not working
threads.message:
Dont have test card.

I checked every solder but all are solid in place

threads.title: 820-2936-B ram slots not working
threads.message: Get the RAM test cards; at least for DDR3/4.

threads.title: 820-2936-B ram slots not working
threads.message:
Hi, got the test card.

Pin 30 lights red, it says "/RESET"

i get 1.5v on MEM_RESET_L

threads.title: 820-2936-B ram slots not working
threads.message:
Hi, got the test card,

The PIN 30 lights red and it says "RESET"

MEM_RESET_L is 1.5v

threads.title: 820-2936-B ram slots not working
threads.message:
All the LEDs must come on.
You have problems with the lines where LEDs stay off.

However, compare MEM_RESET_L level with good board.
